question_stem.en: Researchers studying molecular biology observe a eukaryotic cell via electron microscopy. During interphase of the cell cycle, they notice 10-nm thick chromatin fibers with a "beads on a string" appearance. These chromatin fibers are extracted and treated with an endonuclease, which preferentially cleaves the "string" portions of the chromatin. Further evaluation reveals that the "beads" are composed of DNA wrapped around a core of proteins.
question_stem.zh: 研究人员通过电子显微镜观察真核细胞的分子生物学。在细胞周期的间期，他们注意到10纳米厚的染色质纤维呈现“串珠”状外观。这些染色质纤维被提取并用核酸内切酶处理，核酸内切酶优先切割染色质的“串”部分。进一步评估显示，“珠子”由缠绕在蛋白质核心周围的DNA组成。

question.en: Which of the following proteins is most likely found outside this core and promotes chromatin compaction?
question.zh: 以下哪种蛋白质最有可能位于该核心之外并促进染色质压实？

explanation.en: Histone H1, in contrast to the other histone proteins, is located OUTSIDE the nucleosome core. Histone H1 binds to both the nucleosome and adjacent LINKER DNA, which facilitates packaging of chromatin into a thicker (30-nm), more COMPACT structure (heterochromatin) that limits transcriptional access to the DNA.
explanation.zh: 与其他组蛋白相比，组蛋白H1位于核小体核心之外。组蛋白H1与核小体和相邻的连接DNA结合，这有助于将染色质包装成更厚（30纳米）、更紧密的结构（异染色质），从而限制转录对DNA的访问。

summary.en: 1) Eukaryotic DNA organization 2) Histone H1 is unique in that it is located outside the histone core and helps package nucleosomes into more compact structures, limiting transcriptional access to DNA.
summary.zh: 1) 真核细胞DNA组织 2) 组蛋白H1的独特之处在于它位于组蛋白核心之外，有助于将核小体包装成更紧密的结构，从而限制转录对DNA的访问。
